result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L Repinski

defendant.name: Repinski, Jacob L
defendant.address: 10556 N County Line Rd., Whitewater, WI 53190

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] cases  cases #21CF638, #21CM293, #21CM445, #21CM446, #22CF377, #2CM82 called at 9:01 am [clerk's inserted note:  Co-Defendant (as to Case #22CM82 only) Rachel Kopp's cases were called during this hearing- there are separate minutes for Ms. Kopp's cases] 
Defendant Jacob L Repinski in court with Attorney Larry R Pruden. ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Arraignment is held in Case #22CF377:
--Service of Information is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--In response to the Court's inquiry, Attorney Pruden indicates that the Defense is reserving the right to request a speedy trial.

Attorney Pruden requests that all cases, with the exception of #21CF638, be scheduled for plea and sentencing in mid-December.
ADA Shock requests that a trial date be scheduled in #21CF638.
The Court informs the parties that #21CF638 will be assigned to Branch II after the January 1st Judicial Rotation. 
recess 9:16am

NEXT:  (1) Plea & Sentencing in cases #21CM293, #21CM445, #21CM446, #22CF377, #22CM82, and Status Conference in #21CF 638 --all on December 15th at 8:30am,  (2) FSSC in #21CF638 on March 14th at 9:30am,  (3) Jury Trial in #21CF638 on March 20th at 8:45am

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob L Repinski
Current: 10556 N County Line Rd., Whitewater, WI 53190 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: c/o Rock County Jail 200 US Hwy 14, Janesville, WI 53545
Bond Document rec'd from JESO on 10/3/22

[MK] cases #22CF377 and #22CM82 called at 9:47am 
Defendant Jacob L Repinski in court, in custody, with Attorney Larry Pruden.  ADA  Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

In Case #22CF377 Preliminary Hearing is held: 
Sgt. P. Gallegos -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Parson
--cross examination by Attorney Pruden
--redirect examination by ADA Parson
--recross examination by Attorney Pruden
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Repinski committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
recess 10:00am, reconvene 10:08am 

The Co-Defendant as to Mr. Repinski's case #22CM82 now appears.  
Co-Defendant Rachel Kopp in court, in custody, with Attorney Shunette Campbell Hunter. 
In Case #22CF135 Ms. Kopp waives her right to preliminary Hearing.  The Court accepts this wavier and bonds her over for trial. 
recess 10:14am  

NEXT:  Arraignment in Case #22C377 and Status Conference in Case #22CM82--both on October 24th at 9:00am

Pre-trial conference on September 21, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] cases #22CM82 and #22CF377 called at  9:37am 
Defendant Jacob L Repinski in court, in custody, with Attorney Larry Pruden. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case #22CF377 is scheduled for Initial Appearance today, however Attorney Pruden clarifies that he has not been appointed by the Public Defender yet in case #22CF377. 
in Case #22CF377 the Court requires a $500 Signature Bond with condition:  no possession of drug paraphernalia.  The Court will reschedule the Initial Appearance. 

As to Case #22CM82 Attorney Pruden orally Motions for modification of the Bond condition that prohibits contact with Co-Defendant Rachel Kopp
The Court denies the Motion.  
recess 9:45am , reconvene 10:09am [Co-Defendant's case #22CF135 is also called; see separate minutes as to the Co-Defendant]  
After Attorney Pruden indicates that he has received confirmation that has now been appointed by the Public Defender in case #22CF377 the Initial Appearance is held.
Service of the Criminal Complaint is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
recess 10:27am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on September 21st at 1:40pm,   (2) Status Conference in #22CM82 and Preliminary Hearing in #22CF377 (set along with Co-Def's case)- both on September 23rd at 9:00am
